definition: Extraordinary people in our ordinary world, short stories by novelist Feng Jicai 馮驥才|冯骥才[Feng2 Ji4 cai2]

sentences.chinese: 揹負着俗世的浮塵和愧罪。

sentences.english: It can also be attained by people living an ordinary life, who have a job, are married and have kids.
sentences.chinese: 生活在俗世中有妻有子有工作的凡人也可以獲得。

sentences.english: Mortal woman, who can have such as fox, old confidante?
sentences.chinese: 俗世女子，誰能夠如狐般擁有不老紅顏？

sentences.english: YOU come into the world with nothing, the saying goes.
sentences.chinese: 俗語有云，你一無所有來到這俗世。

sentences.english: You have no choice in the memories while away endless in this earthly reincarnation.
sentences.chinese: 你也無奈於美好記憶消磨在這無盡的俗世輪迴裏。

sentences.english: Van Loon had joined the Unitarian Laymen 's League in 1924.
sentences.chinese: 房龍於1924年加入一神教俗世信徒聯盟。

sentences.english: The rays that come from those heavenly worlds, will separate between him and what he touches.
sentences.chinese: 由天穹灑下之華光，將你與俗世隔離。

sentences.english: The seven deadly sins are about earthly self-indulgence and narcissism.
sentences.chinese: 該七宗罪約俗世自我放縱和自戀。

definition: mundane world (in religious context)/this mortal coil
the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
the world in chaos/troubled times/the mortal world (Buddhism)
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
